elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the following questions about the case study.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: What business names are possible for the clothing boutique if the two form a general partnership?
elements.correctAnswer: The name of a general partnership is freely selectable; however, the legal form or its abbreviation "KlG" must be stated.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Franziska and Andrea agree to give their clothing boutique the name "Boutique Egger KlG". However, there is already a business with this name in a municipality next to the city of Bern. Can they still call their boutique that?
elements.correctAnswer: No, the company must be clearly distinguishable from all companies already registered in Switzerland. The choice of this name violates company exclusivity.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Franziska and Andrea have now changed their minds and are setting up a limited company. Can the clothing boutique bear the name "Manor" if there is no company with the name "Manor" in the city of Bern?
elements.correctAnswer: No. An AG may choose a fantasy name, but this may only be registered once in the HR throughout Switzerland. Since a retail company with the name "Manor" already exists in Switzerland, the choice of this name violates company exclusivity.
